io.github.jansky.ezroute

Class BusRoute

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.jansky.ezroute.BusRoute

  • class BusRoute
extends java.lang.Object
    BusRoute contains a Bus and the origin and destination BusStop, including the number of stops between the origin and destination, inclusive of both stops.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(@Nullable
                      java.lang.Object obj)
        BusRoute equality checks to see if the Bus, origin BusStop, destination BusStop, and number of stops is the same. Generally, a bus route would be equal if it has the same bus, origin, and destination location, but checking for number of bus stops would account for express buses. Although express buses should have an additional suffix lettering to its service number (like 33A or 151A), checking the number of stops is another assurance of equality
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - Any object
        Returns:
        true if both BusRoutes have the same Bus, origin/destination BusStop, and number of bus stops, false otherwise
